attributes.action: Remove the facility whereby private hospitals in the UK may transfer patients to NHS care in the event that something goes wrong with the treatment they are receiving from the private hospital
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Private hospitals in the UK are allowed to operate without having, on site, emergency facilities to cater for any emergency which arises while they are treating their patients outside the NHS.  Private hospitals, when they have an emergency, merely dial 999 and request an ambulance to take the patient to the nearest A & E Department.  Because of this anomaly the true cost of private medical treatment is being borne, mainly, by the UK taxpayer through the NHS.
